## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 327, 358, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 465]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 325, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 509, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 555, 910, 586]]<|/det|>
Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 585, 598, 600]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 600, 606, 616]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 630, 609, 646]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 645, 756, 661]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 660, 440, 676]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Given that \(5^{x} = 3^{4y}\), use logarithms to show that \(y = mx\) and find the value of the constant \(m\) correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 536, 420, 556]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(|4 - x| \leqslant |3 - 2x|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 536, 920, 555]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 546, 92]]<|/det|>
The sequence of values given by the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 100, 583, 139]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = \frac{2x_{n}^{2} + x_{n} + 9}{(x_{n} + 1)^{2}},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 147, 343, 166]]<|/det|>
with \(x_{1} = 2\), converges to \(\alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 178, 156, 196]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 178, 920, 212]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places, giving the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 198, 920, 215]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 500, 186, 518]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 500, 411, 518]]<|/det|>
Determine the exact value of \(\alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 501, 920, 520]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 74, 161, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Express \(2 \cos \theta + (\sqrt{5}) \sin \theta\) in the form \(R \cos (\theta - \alpha)\) where \(R > 0\) and \(0^\circ < \alpha < 90^\circ\), giving the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 528, 186, 546]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 528, 693, 549]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(2 \cos \theta + (\sqrt{5}) \sin \theta = 1\) for \(0^\circ < \theta < 360^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 528, 920, 547]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 83, 650, 280]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 299, 920, 339]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = \tan 2x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{6}\pi\). The shaded region is bounded by the curve and the lines \(x = \frac{1}{6}\pi\) and \(y = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 352, 156, 369]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 351, 920, 386]]<|/det|>
Use the trapezium rule with two intervals to find an approximation to the area of the shaded region, giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[895, 368, 922, 386]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Find the exact volume of the solid formed when the shaded region is rotated completely about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 73, 437, 92]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[308, 98, 688, 120]]<|/det|>
\[x = t^{3} + 6t + 1,\qquad y = t^{4} - 2t^{3} + 4t^{2} - 12t + 5.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 140, 156, 159]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 139, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\) and use division to show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\) can be written in the form \(at + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 165, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 154, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
The straight line \(x - 2y + 9 = 0\) is the normal to the curve at the point \(P\). Find the coordinates of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 84, 620, 310]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 327, 470, 346]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 354, 561, 375]]<|/det|>
\[y = 3x^{2}\ln (\frac{1}{6} x).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 381, 692, 400]]<|/det|>
The curve crosses the \(x\)-axis at the point \(P\) and has a minimum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 412, 156, 429]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 412, 520, 429]]<|/det|>
Find the gradient of the curve at the point \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 413, 920, 431]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 154, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 495, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of the point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
